exp.description: Core team collaborator during couple sprints implementing figma designs in touch with Design team @ CINT. NextJS 13, Tailwind, React, Storybook, React Testing Library and Unit Testing

I've got a chance to collaborate with Potentia Analytics team, where I have been in charge of set up and deliver releases of a React Native, Typescript and Mongo Atlas application for both Google Playstore and Apple Store. This app was interacting with a Machine Learning model that would process audio generating transcriptions, actor detection and summarization.

I worked as a remote contractor for Intive-FDV on the Sabre project, collaborating closely with teams based in the United States. During my time on the project, I contributed to the development of a user interface using ReactJS that is now used in airports. This interface allows travelers to conveniently purchase air tickets or pay for additional baggage

During my time as a team leader at Events.com, I led a team that collaborated on some of the platform's early features built with Angular, Bootstrap, Karma and Jasmine, including payments with Stripe integration. In 2015, I had the chance to visit Events' offices in San Diego, California, and it was an incredible experience. My daily responsibilities included code reviews, bug fixing, collaborating with product owners and project managers, developing new features, and supporting my team members in their tasks.

As part of a collaborative team, I worked closely with a UX designer to develop an early prototype for the Animals section of the National Geographic website. After identifying areas for improvement, we rebuilt the user experience from a completely different perspective. This redesign resulted in a 30% increase in screen traffic during user test validations, demonstrating the effectiveness of our approach.

Dytar was a local startup based in Buenos Aires. Building their products I was able to advocate for the use of JavaScript, PHP and AJAX to reduce the number of page reloads improving user experience. Collaborating on various projects, I utilized jQuery to build certain features, while also using Bootstrap for styling purposes.
Other kind of tasks would also include requirement analysis, entity diagrams, database modeling, normalization, and implementation with MySQL.
In addition during my time there, I had the opportunity to develop an internal chat system using NodeJS and socket.io. Although it was not released, it was a valuable experience for me as it was my first time building a proof-of-concept using Node.
